author: Coral Barry
title: X-ray results show Chelsea striker Diego Costa has avoided serious injury
text:
Diego Costa is on international duty with Spain (Picture: Getty) Chelsea have been informed that Diego Costa has suffered an ankle injury in Spain training.
Revealed: The real reason Jamie Vardy looked like he was wearing make-up However, the Blues have also been told not to worry about their star striker by the Spanish Football Federation.
Costa was pulled from training this week after hurting his ankle and leg and was sent to Sanitas Clinic in La Moralej to undergo scans.
But X-rays showed no serious damage to Costa’s ankle and the striker will remain with the Spain squad until Tuesday.
Chelsea fixtures Crystal Palace (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Manchester City (H) – Wed 5 Apr
Bournemouth (A) – Sat 8 Apr
Manchester United (A) – Sun 16 Apr
Tottenham (N) FA Cup – Sat 22 Apr
Everton (A) – Sun 30 Apr
Middlesbrough (H) – Sat 6 May
West Brom (A) – Sat 13 May
Spain take on rivals France in a friendly on Tuesday and Costa will return with the rest of the Chelsea Spanish contingent to his club after the game.
The Spanish Football Federation revealed Chelsea have been informed of the injury scare.
Costa has avoided serious injury (Picture: Getty) More: Football Hijack complete! Chelsea agree £35m deal for Monaco star courted by Man Utd

Chelsea are top of the Premier League table and are massive ten points clear of second place.
The Blues have relied on the 18 goals from Costa this season, but Eden Hazard and Pedro have chipped in with eleven strikes each.
Costa scored in Spain’s 4-1 win over Israel on Friday while Chelsea host Crystal Palace next Saturday.
